alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Gilmer (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 3:00PM EST until February 04 at 8:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity for the following rivers in West Virginia... Little Kanawha River At Glenville affecting Gilmer and Calhoun Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Little Kanawha River At Glenville. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, River Street is flooded upstream from the old bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM EST Friday the stage was 24.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:45 PM EST Friday was 24.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 5.1 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.0 feet on 03/06/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued this evening at 800 PM EST.
